jisa.devices

Class SMUCluster

  • java.lang.Object
    • jisa.devices.SMUCluster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<SMU>, IMeter, Instrument, ISource, IVMeter, IVSource, MCSMU, MultiChannel<SMU>, SMU, VMeter, VSource

    public class SMUCluster
extends java.lang.Object
implements MCSMU
    Class to combine multiple SMUs into a single virtual SMU with multiple channels.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface jisa.devices.MCSMU

        MCSMU.MCUpdateHandler, MCSMU.Sweep, MCSMU.Updater, MCSMU.VirtualSMU

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface jisa.devices.SMU

        SMU.OffMode, SMU.ProgressMonitor

      Creates an SMUCluster using the given SMU objects.

      void useFourProbe(int channel, boolean fourProbes)
      Sets whether the SMU should apply source using FORCE probes and measure using separate SENSE probes or whether is should do both with the FORCE probes on the specified channel.

      • doSweep

        public IVPoint[] doSweep(int channel,
                         Source source,
                         double[] values,
                         long delay,
                         boolean symmetric,
                         SMU.ProgressMonitor onUpdate)
                  throws DeviceException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: MCSMU
        Performs a logarithmic sweep of either VOLTAGE or CURRENT, returning V-I data points as an array of MCIVPoint objects whilst allowing you to keep track of the sweep's progress via a ProgressMonitor object.
        Specified by:
        doSweep in interface MCSMU
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number to do sweep on
        source - VOLTAGE or CURRENT
        values - Array of values to use in the sweep
        delay - Amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before taking each measurement
        symmetric - Should we sweep back to starting point after sweeping forwards?
        onUpdate - Method ot run each time a new measurement is completed
        Returns:
        Array of MCIVPoint objects containing V-I data points
        Throws:
        DeviceException - Upon incompatibility with device
        java.io.IOException - Upon communications error
